title: Harmonic Echo ignores damage taken multipliers
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.1.0 PTR Build 38312

**Description:**
> The damage done by the AoE component of Harmonic Echo ignores any damage taken multipliers present on the target. In particular, if the target with Radiant Spark debuff does not have any damage reduction and a nearby target does, this bug allows the legendary to bypass the damage reduction entirely.

**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> Find two targets, one of which has a large damage reduction. Cast Radiant Spark on the normal target and trigger Harmonic Echo. Observe that the secondary target (with the damage reduction) takes full damage.

**Howto:**

title: Harmonic Echo does not trigger on the 4th stack of Radiant Spark Vulnerability
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.1.0 PTR Build 38312

**Description:**
> When using the Harmonic Echo legendary, the bonus damage does not trigger from damage that consumes the 4th stack of Radiant Spark Vulnerability.

**Logs, Images, Videos**
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50294688/115233866-a7492900-a0d5-11eb-8881-aded52df4d5e.png)

**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> Equip the Harmonic Echo legendary, cast Radiant Spark on a target, and cast spells into the target until the 4th stack of Radiant Spark Vulnerability is removed. Harmonic Echo will only be triggered three times, as it fails to trigger on the last spell.

title: Radiant Spark does not work properly with multiple Mages
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.5 live Build 38134

**Description:**
> Radiant Spark Vulnerability is reset for all Mages when the stacks are reset for one of them.

**Details:**
> When Radiant Spark Vulnerability's 4th stack is used, the debuff is removed and the Mage is no longer able to generate new stacks. If multiple Mages have Radiant Spark Vulnerability present on a target, then the debuff will be removed for all Mages at once when this happens. Mages other than the one that consumed their 4th stack will be able to generate new Radiant Spark Vulnerability stacks.

**Logs, Images, Videos**
> https://www.warcraftlogs.com/reports/FX9tgW4AqL8JdCm7/#fight=3&view=events&type=summary&pins=2%24Off%24%23244F4B%24expression%24(%20ability.name%3D%22Radiant%20Spark%22%20or%20ability.name%3D%22Radiant%20Spark%20Vulnerability%22%20)%20and%20rawDamage%3D0%20or%20ability.name%3D%22Ice%20Lance%22%20or%20ability.name%3D%22Arcane%20Missiles%22

**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> Have one Mage use Radiant Spark on a target and gain at least one stack of Radian Spark Vulnerability. Have another Mage then consume their 4th stack of Radiant Spark Vulnerability. Both debuffs will be removed.

body:
**Game Version:**

**Description:**

title: Shadowfiend/Mindbender pet modifier does not update fast enough after entering Voidform
body:
**Game Version:**
9.0.5 live Build 37864

**Description:**
When using Mindbender or Shadowfiend, if you cast it before entering Voidform it does not pickup the Voidform modifier until a few seconds (roughly 3 seconds) after you actually used Voidform. This causes any damage from the pet to be exactly 5% behind where it should be for the first few seconds of Voidform (includes melee swings and Shadowflame Prism).

**Details:**
Mindbender/Shadowfiend do not update their modifier fast enough when the player changes their damage state (i.e. Voidform). This causes the damage to be inaccurate if Mindbender is cast outside of Voidform for a few seconds. If Mindbender is cast inside of Voidform this bug is not present.

**Logs, Images, Videos**

### Mindbender before Voidform
![log1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10604059/110562551-5c6be700-810f-11eb-890b-00001af22f48.png)
[Mindbender before Voidform](https://www.warcraftlogs.com/reports/4am8kJjM6nDFHh3L/#fight=1&type=damage-done&source=12&view=events)

In this log you can see this happening with both the melee swings and the Shadowflame Rift damage event.

First melee swing: 726
Melee swing after 3s: 762 (+5%)

First Shadowflame Rift: 2283
Second Shadowflame Rift: 2396 (+5%)
Note* on the second rift you can see the correct Hungering Void modifier is applied on Target 1, which is +15% from the first event (10 from HV + 5 from bug).

### Mindbender inside Voidform
![log2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10604059/110562563-6261c800-810f-11eb-8b16-42ea5cf2d945.png)
[Mindbender inside Voidform](https://www.warcraftlogs.com/reports/wvJhBTbz7RC38tAf/#fight=last&type=damage-done&source=10&view=events)

In this example I took my weapon off so the numbers are slightly different relative to log 1, but that isnt imortant here. You can clearly see that the melee swing damage remains constant at ~538. And the Shadowflame Rift damage sequence that matches log 1 is now correct. The only difference being we used Mindbender inside Voidform.

**Reproducible:**
Yes

**Howto:**
The following lists showcase this with just the melee swings, a more complex example can be seen by using the Shadowflame Prism legendary with Shadowflame Rift, but the bug is the same regardless.

### Bug sequence
1. Cast Mindbender
2. Cast Void Eruption
3. Notice melee swings are 5% lower than they should be for ~3seconds

### No Bug sequence
1. Cast Void Eruption
2. Cast Mindbender
3. Notice melee swings remain constant

title: Flagellation is using some builder and finisher interactions
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.5 PTR Build 37844

**Description:**
After removing Energy cost and CP generation from it it seems to have some leftover interactions of both builders and finishers.

- Flagellation does get the guaranteed critical strike from Symbols of Death Rank 2 on the instant damage. However, it does not consume the corresponding buff.
- ~~Flagellation is treated as a generator by Shadow Blades and the instant damage causes 50% additional shadow damage. However, it does not cause any combo point gains.~~
- Using Flagellation instant damage during Dreadblades does not generate any CP but instead seems to be treated as a finisher, causing a 5% HP drain on the player. Ouchie. Flagellation is what I'd like to call Schrödinger's Finisher now.

(Saw no issues with Broadside or Seal Fate.)

title: Minor Mutilate tooltip damage formula bug
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 live Build 36753

**Description:**
Mutilate tooltip uses a manually specified formula of `MHSpellDmg+OHSpellDmg*0.5` for the displayed damage value in spell data. However, the tooltip calculation already knows that the Off-Hand spell is dealing half damage so this manual halving halves it twice.

**Example:**

With my values in a test setup, I calculated for the individual spell data
Main Hand: 791
Off Hand: 395

Combined would be: `791+395=1186`
Instead, the tooltip does and shows: `791+395*0.5=989`

title: Doomblade / Mutilated Flesh damage is using target modifiers from debuff amps
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 live Build 36753

**Description:**
> This is an issue that appeared in beta but was fixed towards the end of beta. However it appears to have resurfaced on live. Although the second Mutilate hit is refreshing the DoT, it is not dealing the correct amount of residual damage. This is causing the Legendary to deal significantly less damage than it is intended to.

**Details:**
> In the log below, the first hit is 679, the second is 328. This immediately pandemics up with a refresh visible in the logs. The DoT then ticks 3 times for 71 damage. The total DoT damage should be 302, but is only 213. It is not that it is totally ignoring the OH hit, as it triggers a refresh and OH crits are shown to bias the damage. However, it is somehow losing residual damage or a tick--perhaps due to the pandemic duration and odd tick rate.

**Logs, Images, Videos**
> https://www.warcraftlogs.com/reports/NHFz4RgYy9nBXMwK/#fight=1&type=damage-done&start=8799&end=143672&pins=0%24Separate%24%23244F4B%24auras-gained%241%240.0.0.Any%240.0.0.Any%24true%240.0.0.Any%24false%24340431%5E2%24Separate%24%23909049%24damage%240%240.0.0.Any%24188078822.0.0.Rogue%24true%240.0.0.Any%24false%245374%5E2%24Separate%24%23a04D8A%24damage%240%240.0.0.Any%24188078822.0.0.Rogue%24true%240.0.0.Any%24false%2427576%5E2%24Separate%24%23DF5353%24damage%240%240.0.0.Any%24188078822.0.0.Rogue%24true%240.0.0.Any%24false%24340431&source=7&view=events

> 100%

title: Disciplinary Command can be triggered by background actions
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 live Build 37474

**Description:**
> The Mage legendary, Disciplinary Command, triggers its effect once the Mage casts an Arcane spell, a Fire spell, and a Frost spell within 10 seconds. Expected behavior is that this should only trigger when the Mage casts an active spell. In game, this is triggering from passive spells, including spells that operate in the background and are really just part of other spells.

**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> * Talent into Flame Patch and cast a Flamestrike. Wait for just over 10 seconds and then cast a Frost spell and an Arcane spell. Disciplinary Command will trigger even though Flamestrike was cast over 10 seconds ago because the Flame Patch ticks are counting as Fire casts.
> * Select the Diverted Energy conduit and cast Blazing Barrier and Frost Nova. Next take damage from an enemy within 10 seconds. Disciplinary Command will trigger even though no Arcane spell was ever cast because Diverted Energy's healing procs are counting as Arcane casts.

title: The impact of Phoenix Flames is sometimes delayed
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 live Build 37474

**Description:**
> Phoenix Flames sometimes has impact delays that can result in Phoenix Flames removing Heating Up unexpectedly.

**Details:**
> Normally when casting Fireball and Phoenix Flames at the same time, the damage event for Phoenix Flames reaches the client either at the same time as, or about 100 ms after the Fireball damage event. However, there is a specific distance window where the delay suddenly increases to somewhere between 400 ms and 500 ms. This window seems to occur somewhere around 16 - 18 yards; however, the window may be a function of model height because that affects spell travel time.

**Logs, Images, Videos**
> Training Dummy (NPC ID: 174569) in Ardenweald - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e23cMb3GKaQ
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50294688/107850369-08dfd500-6dbf-11eb-9f7d-9c414f8e2767.png)

**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> Stand around 17 yards from the Training Dummy (NPC ID: 174569) in Ardenweald. Cast Fireball and queue Phoenix Flames so that they both cast at the same time. Phoenix Flames should have a much longer delay in its impact than when you do the same thing from most other ranges.

title: Arcane Momentum can cause Shimmer to cancel the Mage's casts
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 live Build 36753
> This bug has been around since at least early BFA, potentially since Shimmer was added.

**Description:**
> Shimmer can cause the Mage to appear a few units above the ground and then fall very briefly. If the player has enough world latency, the buff granted by Shimmer that allows spells to be cast while moving will not last long enough to prevent this tiny fall from canceling their cast.

> With Arcane Momentum, the buff that allows the player to cast while moving only lasts around 300 ms instead of 650 ms, which causes spells to cancel quite easily when Arcane Momentum is used.

**Logs, Images, Videos**
> https://i.gyazo.com/47786bf5f96472c166b9845502a270e7.mp4

**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> Enable Arcane Momentum, start casting a spell, and then use Shimmer. If the player's world latency is high enough, the cast will be canceled somewhat reliably.

title: The GCD of Wild Spirits is affected by haste twice
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 live Build 36753

**Description:**
> The global cooldown of Wild Spirits is affected by haste twice. 
> With 12.3% haste I expect a 1.335 GCD, but was getting a 1.189 GCD

**Reproducible:**
> Examples: yes

**Howto:**

title: Shadow Dance / Stealth tooltip update bugs in PvP for Subtlety
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 live Build 36949

### Description

Let's have a look at Shadow Dance and regular Stealth tooltips with Nightstalker in PvP / when engaged to the PvP dummy.

**Shadow Dance Buff**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/161936/102657372-d6767a80-4175-11eb-9f7b-275f13a8daf7.png)

This one is working as intended. It shows the 8% pvp damage value taken from the dummy value on itself with pvp coefficients being reflected properly.

However, let's looks at **Stealth and Shadow Dance abilities**.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/161936/102657825-af6c7880-4176-11eb-807b-f5acd78ede64.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/161936/102657840-b4c9c300-4176-11eb-85b3-03104b58cfc1.png)

Both now show 6% in the Nightstalker part. A very unexpected value but it gets funnier when I leave the pvp dummy and watch my tooltip change.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/161936/102666807-1ba3a800-4188-11eb-8739-bcbcb875da73.png)

Now it's going up to 16% where we would expect it to reset to the non-pvp 12%. Using Stealth/Dance shows the correct 12% but the ability tooltip continues to say 16 until I change the talent and swaps back to 6% against the dummy.

So what's going on here? Let's look at the pvp coefficients again.

In the case of Sub there are these two factors:
- Nightstalker spell itself with value 50 and pvp coeff 0.5
- Subtlety Rogue spec aura modifying it by -38 with pvp coeff 0.894

The way this is calculated to work is recursively so the formula would be
```
(50-38*0.894)*0.5 = 8.014
```
This gives the intended 8% in PvP.

However, we are seeing 6 and 16% both of which can be reproduced with the following two formulae.

```
(50-38*0.894) = 16.028
(50-38*1)*0.5 = 6
```

The 16% value appears to be the same issue as with the Nightstalker talent (see #778) in that it does not factor in the pvp coefficient on the base talent.

The 6% value is the opposite. For some reason it now uses the base talent coeff but reset the one coming from the spec aura.

I do believe that all of this is entirely display bugs from processing the calculation on the tooltips, I did not test any pvp damage numbers in detail to make sure everything is working fine there though.

title: Nightstalker grants increased Poison proc chance in true Stealth
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 live Build 36949

### Description

Due to mistakes when setting up spell data for the (not working, see #426) Improved Poisons rank 2, Nightstalker spell data is causing true Stealth to give increased poison proc chance.

### Details

What's going on here? Let's have a look at the second effect on the Nightstalker talent in spell data:

```
#2 (id=165808)   : Apply Aura (6) | Add Flat Modifier (107): Spell Effect 4 (32)
                   Base Value: 50 | Scaled Value: 50 | PvP Coefficient: 0.50000 | Misc Value: 32 | Target: Self (1)
                   Affected Spells: Stealth (1784), Vanish (11327), Stealth (115191), Shadow Dance (185422)
```

It adds 50 percent points (modified by PvP and Subtlety Rogue spec aura) to effect 4 on stealth spell 1784.

Now, effect 4 on Stealth is this:

```
#4 (id=219900)   : Apply Aura (6) | Add Flat Modifier (107): Spell Proc Chance (18)
                   Base Value: 0 | Scaled Value: 0 | PvP Coefficient: 1.00000 | Misc Value: 18 | Target: Self (1)
                   Affected Spells: Deadly Poison (2823), Crippling Poison (3408), Numbing Poison (5761), Wound Poison (8679), Leeching Poison (108211), Instant Poison (315584)
```

This is the effect that is supposed to be set to 100% by improved poisons.

The other fourth effects Nightstalker modifies there are Vanish (a dummy effect), Subterfuge Stealth spell (does not matter since NS and Subt are exclusive but it is also a poison proc chance effect here), and Shadow Dance buff (also a dummy effect), so these should be "fine" and are just supposed to be used to show the damage increase in tooltips from what I can tell.

title: Nightstalker not showing PvP value correctly
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 live Build 36949

### Description
When entering PvP combat (reproducible on the PvP dummies in Orgrimmar), the Nightstalker talent itself does not properly reflect the way its pvp coefficients are set up.

In the case of Sub there are these two factors:
- Nightstalker spell itself with value 50 and pvp coeff 0.5
- Subtlety Rogue spec aura modifying it by -38 with pvp coeff 0.894

The way this is calculated to work is recursively so the formula would be
```(50-38*0.894)*0.5 = 8.014```
This gives the intended 8% in PvP.

However, in the talent screen, it does not appear to apply the pvp coefficient on the talent itself (which is probably a general bug and not rogue specific). So, in this case the spec aura factor is still changing in PvP where the talent value is not, so the formula for the display ends up being
```50-38*0.894 = 16.028```
This gives the shown wrong number of 16% in the tooltip.

Assassination does not have these chained pvp coefficients. There is only the base 0.5 pvp coefficient on the talent which, this is the bug, is not respected, so Nightstalker always shows 50% on Assassination where it should be 25%.

### Logs, Images, Videos
Nightstalker talent on Subtlety in PvP.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/161936/102655567-cf9a3880-4172-11eb-9cc0-c6317458ccee.png)

title: Primal Tidal Core selects targets off player GUID instead of random injured
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 live Build 36753

**Description:**
> The legendary Primal Tidal Core for Restoration Shaman does not target random injured friendlies and instead favors player GUID instead, meaning it can spread Riptide to targets at 100% health instead of someone that is injured, even if both players are within the 10yd range. 

**Details:**
> Primal Tidal Core spreads an additional Riptide to a friendly target every 4 casts, so long as a friendly player is within 10 yards of your last Riptide target AND the player does not currently have a Riptide on them from the casting Shaman. Most 'random' healing effects like this simply target random injured allies so long as they meet all other requirements, however this legendary is instead only targeting off of player GUID. A brand new character will get 100% of the additional Riptides from the legendary if they are within range. 

**Reproducible:**
> Yes, easily

**Howto:**
> Simply have 1 character with Primal Tidal Core (legendary) and have 2 other friendlies near you (player A, B, and C). Player A has the legendary Primal Tidal Core and simply casts Riptide repeatedly on either player B or player C (make sure you're all within 10yds of each other). You should find that every proc should select the same character, regardless of healthpool differences, so long as everyone is within range and does not already have a Riptide on them. You can use the command /dump UnitGUID('player') to determine each characters GUID. I'm not familiar with exactly how GUID's work other than the fact that they stick with the player for forever, however we found that the newest created characters were always selected for PTC procs. If player B was selected for every single proc during the first test, you can simply create a new 'player C' (brand new character) and should find that the target selection changes to player C.

title: Focus Magic chains with multiple Mages can incorrectly dispel the buff
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 beta Build 36401

**Description:**
> To make this description clearer, I define the **long FM** as the 30 minute Focus Magic buff (spell id: 321358) that a Mage can directly cast on another player and the **short FM** as the 10 second Focus Magic buff (spell id: 321363) that a player with the long FM procs onto the player who gave them the long FM.

> When Mage 1 receives a long FM buff from another Mage 2 and casts their own long FM on a different player, there is an issue when Mage 1 crits where the short FM buff they proc onto Mage 2 will remove the long FM buff that they cast on the other player. 

> Expected behavior is that a long FM buff is only removed when you cast the long FM buff on another target. Short FM buffs should not be removing it when they proc onto a different target.

> If a chain of Focus Magic effects is formed between three Mages, this bug will quickly dispel all but one of the three long FM buffs.

**Logs, Images, Videos**
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50294688/97772603-4a00f180-1b0e-11eb-9922-5dc7fb3e674f.png)

**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> The simplest way to reproduce this bug is to use two Mages, one of which is Frost. Have the other Mage cast Focus Magic on the Frost Mage, and have the Frost Mage cast Focus Magic on their own Water Elemental. When the Frost Mage crits, it will remove the long FM they used on their own Water Elemental. Alternatively, get a group of three players, at least two of which are Mages and do the same thing.

title: When refreshing Arcane Missiles, it is possible to gain extra ticks
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 beta Build 36086

**Description:**
> Without any procs, Arcane Missiles should fire 5 missiles. With Clearcasting Rank 2 and Amplification, Arcane Missiles should fire 8 missiles. By precisely refreshing Arcane Missiles with Clearcasting just after the second to last tick of Arcane Missiles with no proc, Arcane Missiles can hit 14 times (greater than 5+8=13). Instances of 15 hits are also possible, but seem to have strict haste requirements and difficult to hit timing windows.

> ~~This bug seems to be caused by the duration of the second Arcane Missiles being extended by an amount equal to the time until the next tick of the previous Arcane Missiles. This would be fine, except that the old tick does not happen and instead a full set of new ticks is scheduled along the channel. Because Arcane Missiles ticks much faster with Clearcasting, the longer extra duration from the previous tick time can be enough to allow more than just the last tick from the previous channel to fit into the new channel.~~

> **This bug actually seems to be caused by an error in how the refreshed duration is included when using rounding to get a whole number of ticks for Arcane Missiles**

**Logs, Images, Videos**
> This combat log shows a regular Arcane Missiles cast followed by a Clearcasting Arcane Missiles cast. The second Arcane Missiles is cast just after the 4th tick launches from the first Arcane Missiles cast. There are 14 ticks in total, instead of the intended 13.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50294688/96726217-f99bce00-136e-11eb-9134-66b53bd8f980.png)

**Reproducible:**
> Yes, but adding ticks can be more difficult with some haste values.

**Howto:**
> Select Amplification as a talent. Cast Arcane Missiles repeatedly until Clearcasting is gained. Wait until just after any tick of that Arcane Missiles cast except for the last and then refresh Arcane Missiles. If done correctly, Arcane Missiles will have at least one extra tick during the fast Clearcasting cast.

title: When the Enlightened mana regeneration buff expires, extra mana can be gained by the Mage
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 beta Build 36086

**Description:**
> When the Enlightened

**Logs, Images, Videos**
> This image shows the amount of mana gained between each UNIT_POWER_UPDATE event. Here the Mage gains twice as much mana on the tick where the Enlightened mana regen buff expires.
 ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50294688/96670497-aa2cb200-131c-11eb-9fce-3d20d98b16d2.png)
This appears to be because the server performs two updates to the player's mana at once without correctly resetting a timer between mana regeneration events. This bug likely applies to many other similar buffs, but the chance of having a buff that gives mana regeneration expire at the same time as a periodic UNIT_POWER_UPDATE event is very low making it extremely unlikely to occur.

**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> Talent into Enlightened and spend well below 70% mana (to at least 50% to make the bug more visible). Observe the player's mana as it regenerates past 70%.

title: Decimating Bolt Buff Can Be Used More Than 3 Times
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 beta Build 36086

**Description:**
The bonus damage from Decimating Bolt buff can be used more than the intended number of times

**Reproducible:**
Yes

**Howto:**
Using a standard template character, stand at max range and cast the Decimating Bolt covenant spell. Chain casting Shadow Bolts as Affliction will cause 4 Shadow Bolts to benefit from the buff instead of 3. This is happening because the buff is consumed on Shadow Bolt impact, while the damage is calculated at cast finish, allowing more Shadow Bolts to benefit before the buff is removed. Higher haste levels can shrink the required distance or potentially increase the number of buffed spells while this remains as-is.

title: Affliction Warlock Mana Consumption is Too High
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.1 live Build 36247

**Description:**
Affliction can lose mana during a regular raid fight.

**Details:**
Many Affliction spells and talents cost 100 mana but are instant cast. With a mana regeneration rate of 100 mana per second, this is not an issue until a critical amount of Haste is reached and spells begin to be cast faster than once per second. Roughly speaking, this occurs with 50% Haste or higher, easily achievable currently with procs from enchants and items. This is particularly a problem for Affliction because only a few spells (Malefic Rapture, Seed of Corruption) cost zero mana, so the usual rotation does not often have breaks to allow mana to regenerate.

**Logs, Images, Videos**
Randomly picked example log from Shad'har: https://www.warcraftlogs.com/reports/gnFxk1tKf8wDWTpB#fight=29&type=resources&source=44&spell=100

**Reproducible:**
Yes. Observable whenever haste is above approximately 50% and performing a typical rotation for Affliction (more likely with more active talents such as Haunt, Siphon Life, Phantom Singularity, or in multitarget scenarios where more time is spent on applying DoTs)

title: The order of Mirrors of Torment damage effects is incorrect when multiple Mages use it on the same target.
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 beta Build 36086

**Description:**
> Mirrors of Torment has two separate damage effects: Agonizing Backlash and Tormenting Backlash. Agonizing Backlash is meant to deal damage on the first and second hit, while Tormenting Backlash is meant to do damage on the third hit. When multiple Mages use Mirrors of Torment on the same target, the counter that keeps track of this appears to be shared between Mages resulting in unexpected behavior.
For example:
- One Mage may see Tormenting Backlash trigger early and Agonizing Backlash on their later hits.
- Fewer than the expected number of Tormenting Backlash triggers may occur.

**Logs, Images, Videos**
Combat logs from two Mages using Mirrors of Torment on the same target with staggered ICDs. Here, one of the Mages has Tormenting Backlash trigger on their second mirror (the third hit overall).
![Mage 1](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/567703178603135006/761018847162531850/unknown.png)
![Mage 2](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/567703178603135006/761018854595100672/unknown.png)

Combat logs from two Mages using Mirrors of Torment on the same target with the same ICDs. Here, one of the Mages has Tormenting Backlash trigger on their second mirror (the third hit overall). Additionally, Tormenting Backlash is triggered only once out of all six hits.
![Mage 1](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/567703178603135006/761023034475282452/unknown.png)
![Mage 2](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/567703178603135006/761023027927842837/unknown.png)

**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> Cast Mirrors of Torment from two Mages on the same target and observe what happens as it triggers for both Mages.

title: Unholy Death Knight's talent Unholy Blight applies Virulent Plague in an area around each target hit.

On top of the application process being somewhat inconsistent (see #673 ), Virulent Plague will act the same way it does when it is triggered by Outbreak, and apply to all enemies in an area hit by the initial tick. This area seems to be edge-to-edge and can easily reach outside the original radius of Unholy Blight, leading to situations where the player hits only a single enemy with Unholy Blight in very close range, but Virulent Plague spreads around to more enemies.

It seems that you need to pretty much hug your target to apply both dots reliably (see picture#2).

title: Frost Death's Knight talent Glacial Advance applies Razorice even if it's not runeforged
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.1 PTR Build 35944

**Description:**
> Glacial Advance doesn't require Runeforge of Razorice on a weapon to apply it anymore. Back in Legion and BfA, as well as in prior Shadowlands builds, Glacial Advance would only apply Razorice if the runeforge was enchanted on one of your weapons. This is not the case anymore and Glacial Advance always procs Razorice, regardless of runeforges.

> The spell's tooltip has always reflected this behaviour, and the new behaviour might be considered a bugfix for the previous state if you only go by the tooltip's definition of the spell. That said, the tooltip also mentions that the player summons "glacial spikes from the ground that advance forward, **each** dealing X frost damage and applying Razorice to enemies near their eruption point", but it only deals damage once per enemy.

> Note: Glacial Advance's razorice application has always been an odd one, since it doesn't actually trigger the damage component but only the debuff.


**Reproducible:**
> Yes

**Howto:**
> Make sure Razorice is not runeforged on your weapon(s), cast Glacial Advance on an enemy, they will be affected with Razorice.

title: Death Knight's Talent Voracious increases Death Strike healing by an incorrect amount.
body:
**Game Version:**

**Description:**

edit:The 7% maxhp -> 10% maxhp by itself results in a ~43% increase in healing, very far from the 20% in tooltip.

> Compare healing done by Death Strike with no damage intake with and without Voracious talented.

title: Bloodseeker measures range to center of hitbox, instead of to edge like melee attacks
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.1 beta Build 35432

**Description:**
> Survival Hunter Bloodseeker(talent)
Secondary effect (Predator, 10% attack speed) - 12 yards distance is measured towards the very center of the target units hitbox, and causes detection issues on larger mobs. up to the point where you can be well in melee range, but still outside of Predator range. with no way to get closer to the mobs on many stationary targets, or having an effectively smaller melee range on many other bosses in order to maintain the effect.
>
> On raider-dummies, you will only barely be able to step any further when harpoon is usable from its minimum range, indicating that bloodseekers detection range is measured to the center of the dummy, and Harpoons minimum range is measured to the edge of the dummies hitbox
On Wrathion, you will not gain the buff if you stand as far as you can whilst auto attacking, you also will not be able to harpoon as you are still in the minimum distance (8yd), Bloodseeker (12yd) will be missing as it measures to the center of the hitbox, and not the edge like other abilities and auto attacks do.

**Reproducible:**
> Examples: yes

**Howto:**
> You can use Raiders training dummies, however the larger the target enemy, the more noticable the effect is. (for example, Wrathion, first boss Nyalotha)
> - Talent into Bloodseeker, and dismiss your active pet first.
> - Talent into Wildfire infusion, and use shrapnel bomb to supply the bleed effect, or have another class provide a bleed effect for you (easier)
> - Throw Shrapnel bomb at your target, apply the bleeding effect, and walk backwards untill you lose your predator buff
> - Check the distance at which you lose your Predator buff, crosscheck this with your auto attack range, aswell as Harpoon minimum distance.

title: Embryonic Vigor in the Temple of Sethraliss Breaks some Cooldowns
body:
**Game Version:**
> 8.1.5 Live Build 29981

**Description:**
> An interaction between the Embryonic Vigor buff and actions with a category cooldown results in unexpected behavior of the cooldown of those actions. This is the cause of a common issue that Frost Mages encounter in this dungeon, which results in Frozen Orb becoming unusable for extended periods.

**Details:**
> In the Temple of Sethraliss, Faithless Tenders interact with the eggs to gain Embryonic Vigor. When a Mage obtains this buff with with Spellsteal its tooltip states that "Spells cast have their cooldown reduced by 50%."
> There is a strange interaction between this buff and actions that have a "category cooldown." As an example using a Frost Mage, common actions with a category cooldown include Frozen Orb, Ice Barrier, Counterspell, and trinkets with an on-use effect. There are several issues that are caused by this interaction:
> (A) All trinkets with an on-use effect will trigger a cooldown of only 10 seconds (50% of the 20 second category cooldown that is applied to on-use trinkets). This will likely be the case for any action with a category cooldown that is different from its cooldown.
> (B) Blizzard does not reduce the cooldown of Frozen Orb, which instead has a fixed cooldown of 30 seconds (50% of the 60 second category cooldown associated with Frozen Orb).
> (C) Multiple actions with a category cooldown can interfere with eachother when combined with this buff. Specifically, abilities with a category cooldown that are used while other abilities with a category cooldown are already on cooldown can prevent those other abilities from being usable when they appear to come off cooldown.

**Logs, Images, Videos**
> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4Q705T-9MFg

**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> Issue (A) can be reproduced by using a trinket with an on-use effect that shares a cooldown with other trinkets while Embryonic Vigor is active.

> Issue (B) can be reproduced by hitting something with Blizzard after casting Frozen Orb with Embryonic Vigor active.

> An example of issue (C) with two abilities:
> (1) Ice Barrier is used, which has a 12 second cooldown with this buff active.
> (2) Before the apparent cooldown of Ice Barrier completes, Counterspell is used, which has a 12 second cooldown.
> (3) Ice Barrier will appear to come off cooldown, but cannot be used until Counterspell's 12 second cooldown has completed.

> An example of issue (C) with three abilities:
> (1) Counterspell, Ice Barrier, and Frozen Orb are used in a sequence with a few seconds before each spell.
> (2) When Counterspell appears to come off cooldown, it cannot be used until the cooldown of Frozen Orb completes.
> (3) When Ice Barrier appears to come off cooldown, it can be used immediately.

> Another example of issue (C) with three abilities, shown in the video above:
> (1) Frozen Orb is used.
> (2) Ice Barrier is used just before Frozen Orb appears to come off cooldown, preventing Frozen Orb from being used.
> (3) Before Ice Barrier's cooldown completes, Counterspell is used.
> (4) When Ice Barrier appears to come off cooldown, Frozen Orb still cannot be used, but Ice Barrier can be used.
> (5) The Mage can continue chaining this effect by keeping either Ice Barrier or Counterspell on cooldown, which prevents Frozen Orb from being usable indefinitely until the cooldown of the last of these actions used during the Embryonic Vigor buff has completed.

title: Shatter combo breaks in melee range
body:
**Game Version:**
> 8.0.1 Live Build 28833

**Description:**
> Normally, casting Glacial Spike, Ebonbolt or Frostbolt and immediately following it up with a Brain Freeze empowered Flurry, Winter's Chill is applied before those spells hit, allowing them to benefit from Shatter. However, when standing very close to the target, Winter's Chill is applied AFTER those spells hit, making it impossible to perform the Shatter combo.

**Details:**
> Even though Flurry hits before Glacial Spike, Ebonbolt or Frostbolt hit, Winter's Chill is applied with a small delay (roughly 20-40 ms), at which point it's already too late.

> Note: this was also tested with >33.34% crit to make sure it's not just a combat log issue. With this much crit, it is impossible to not crit against a frozen target. However, in melee range, it is possible to not get a crit even when the combo is done properly, implying that the target isn't frozen at that point.

**Logs, Images, Videos**
> Flurry is cast immediately after Glacial Spike

title: Icicle damage is not calculated on impact
body:
**Game Version:**
> 8.0.1 Alpha Build 26287

**Description:**
> Unlike all other Frost spells with travel time, Icicles use caster's crit, spell power, mastery, etc. at the moment they are launched instead of when they impact.

**Details:**
> This is easily testable with Shatter. For all other spells with travel time, you can cast the spell and then cast Freeze/Frost Nova to get the extra crit bonus for the spell that's already in flight. Icicles do not get the extra crit if you freeze the target mid flight.

**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> Cast Frostbolt 5 times, cast another Frostbolt (an Icicle overflows) and Frost Nova/Freeze the target. Even if you have above 34% crit, the Icicle won't always crit.

title: Mastery: Main Gauche scales with Main Hand
body:
**Game Version:**
> 8.0.1 Alpha Build 26175

**Description:**
> The Main Gauche Mastery for Outlaw currently scales with the Main Hand DPS on Alpha.
As additional feedback, the damage is not very transparent, atm. What does e.g. 20% Mastery mean to someone seeing that percentage? The damage number in the tooltip just changes based on that and the formula does not seem to be very straightforward (likely because there are also weird modifiers in spell data, like 0.001 AP and 0.02 SP in addition to the Mastery value).
That being said, I like the change from a scaling proc chance to scaling damage. As a suggestion, maybe have Main Gauche deal a fixed base amount of damage (AP based on the Off Hand) and scale it with the Mastery. In that scenario, it would be more clear to understand that, e.g. with 20% Mastery, there was some base damage increased by 20%.

title: Arcane Charge resources and effects sometimes desync
body:
**Game Version:**
> 8.0.1 Alpha Build 26032

**Description:**
> The number of Arcane Charges displayed by the resource bar doesn't always match the effect.

**Details:**
> This can happen in at least three cases:

> * You have more than 1 Arcane Charge and enter boss combat, the Arcane Charge resource is reset back to one, but the effect isn't
> * You logout with more than 1 Arcane Charge and then log back in, you will have zero Arcane Charges on the resource display, but you keep the effect you had before you logged out
> * When Arcane Charges decay out of combat, the effect doesn't decrease until the last Arcane Charge decays.

> Aside from being confusing for the player, this can be potentially exploited since it seems that some effects trigger based on the resource. For example, suppose we generate two Arcane Charges and then remain out of combat until one of those charges decays. When we then cast Arcane Blast, the mana cost and damage is one "charge" ahead of the resource display but Rule of Threes still trigger when the display reaches three charges, therefore allowing us to get the mana discount on Arcane Blast with +400% mana cost (rather than the usual +300% mana cost Arcane Blast).

**Logs, Images, Videos**
> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r3NNRNsv8Ss

**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> Cast Arcane Blast until you have four Arcane Charges, remain out of combat until you only have one Arcane Charge and then cast Arcane Blast again. It will do the same damage as 4 Arcane Charge Arcane Blast.

title: [Talent] Tier 2 talent switching doesn't always update bonus correctly
body:
**Game Version:**
> 8.0.1 Alpha Build 26032

**Description:**
> If you swap to the talent Nightstalker while already in stealth you do not gain the bonuses associated with the talent until you exit stealth and reenter stealth. This does not work the other way around, as in if you have Nightstalker and swap talent you do not retain the nightstalker buffs.

**Details:**
> The bonus isn't applied neither to the tooltip or in game if you do tests on hitting a dummy. On live this works as expected, the bug is only in BFA currently.
This is also only for subtlety, for assassination it works as it should.

**Reproducible:**
> Examples: yes

**Howto:**
> Be in stealth. Be subtlety. Have a talent that's not nightstalker. Hover stealth tooltip then shadowstrike a target dummy. Now restealth, swap you nightstalker, repeat and you'll see you gain nothing.  
Restealth again and it will be working as expected.

title: Garothi Worldbreaker melee attacks don't trigger on-melee hits taken effects
body:
**Game Version:**
> 7.3.2 - Antorus release

**Description:**
> Garothi Worldbreaker's melee attacks don't correctly trigger effects that usually happen when a tank is damaged by a melee attack.

**Details:**
To my knowledge, this affects 
- Blood Death Knight's Bone Shield (doesn't get consumed on melee hits),
- Apocalypse Drive trinket (doesn't see its cooldown reduced when taking a melee hit),
- Vengeance Demon Hunter T21 4P bonus (does not reduce Metamorphosis' cooldown when parrying an attack)

**Reproducible:**
> Yes

**Howto:**
> Play as a tank on this encounter with any of the bugged behavior mentioned in Details

title: Death Knight dots have a fixed tick rate
body:
**Game Version:**
> 8.0.1 Alpha Build 26010

**Description:**
> Death Knight is the only class with significant dots still having a fixed tick rate.

**Details:**
> With Rogues and Feral druids now having hasted ticks on their bleed/poison dots, only death knights have a fixed tick rate on their dots. Plagues all share the same 3s tick timer and other dots such as Remorseless Winter or Death and Decay also have a fixed tick rate of 1s.

**Reproducible:**
> Yes.

**Howto:**
> Log combat with any DK dot.

title: Blizzard updates its tick time too eagerly
body:
**Game Version:**
> 8.0.1 Alpha Build 25976

**Description:**
> Blizzard updates its tick time after it was cast. This means that if you gain a haste buff (such as Icy Veins), it will do more than 8 ticks. And conversely, if you lose a haste buff, it will do less than 8 ticks.

**Details:**
> This is really awkward with short duration haste procs (such as Mark of the Claw), because they rarely have enough power to give Blizzard 9th tick but their expiration very easily removes the 8th tick.

**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> Cast Blizzard and activate Icy Veins right after.

title: Fingers of Frost break with high haste
body:
**Game Version:**
> 8.0.1 Alpha Build 25976

**Description:**
> Fingers of Frost "status" can be removed from Ice Lances that are already in flight.

**Details:**
> If you cast Ice Lance with Fingers of Frost and then cast another one without Fingers of Frost BEFORE the first impacts, none of them will deal full damage. The converse is true as well, i.e. casting Ice Lance without Fingers of Frost and then one with Fingers of Frost will make both deal full damage.

**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> Get to ~100% haste, stand at max range, cast Ice Lance with Fingers of Frost and immediately cast another one (without Fingers of Frost).
